bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, April 7, 1954

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that Cornelia Knox Kean has died and will be buried in Arlington National Cemetery.

div1.head: Telegram from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, April 7, 1954
div1.p:
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.

SYMBOLS
---------------
DL=Day Letter
---------------
NL=Night Letter
---------------
LT=Int'l Letter Telegram
---------------
VLT=Int'l Victory Ltr.
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination

MA019 AA052
A. WA118 RX PD=WASHINGTON DC 7 848AME=

MRS JEFFERSON KEAN DIED TUESDAY MORNING FUNERAL SERVICES
ARLINGTON CEMETERY THURSDAY AFTERNOON=
THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
